word_mean: 核〔糖核〕蛋白体，核糖体：为一大分子结构，有两个可离解的亚单位，是蛋白质的合成部位(见translation)。两个亚单位共含4个不同的核糖体RNA(rRNA)链和约70种不同的蛋白质。真核生物胞液中的核糖体分子量为4，500，000，沉积系数分别为80S
两个亚单位的沉积系数分别为60S和40S。原核生物和线粒体中的核糖体较小(70S)，它们对某些抗生素的敏感性也不同于真核生物核糖体

sentence.Network_en: Later work clearly showed that a ribosome contains many different proteins.
sentence.Network_cn: 近的工作清楚地表明了核蛋白体包括许多不同的蛋白质.

sentence.Network_en: Altman's area of expertise is the structure of ribosome, minute structures that synthesize proteins inside cells.
sentence.Network_cn: 沃特曼的专业领域是核蛋白体的结构, 即细胞内合成蛋白质的微结构.

sentence.Network_en: There were abundant mitochondria, rough surfaced endoplasmic reticulum and ribosome.
sentence.Network_cn: 胞质内有丰富的线粒体 、 粗面内质网、核糖体.

means.word_mean: 1. an organelle in the cytoplasm of a living cell; ribosomes attach to mRNA and move down it one codon at a time and stop until tRNA brings the required amino acid; when a ribosome reaches a stop codon it falls apart and releases the completed protein mole

sentences.sentence: "the ribosome is the site of protein synthesis"
